turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Hellas quadrangle.
turn.2: The layered ice is exposed in triangular shaped depressions.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: One wall is very steep and faces the pole.
turn.5: Was there ever any speculation why it formed?
turn.6: The fact that water-ice makes up the layers was confirmed by Compact Reconnaissance Imaging Spectrometer for Mars (CRISM) on board the Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter (MRO).
turn.8: The spectra gathered by CRISM showed strong signals of water.
turn.10: The layers are especially prominent in depressions in Hellas quadrangle as shown in the enlarged views below.
turn.11: What else did the analysis say?
turn.12: Besides being of great value to future explorers, these ice layers could help us better understand the climate history of Mars.
